title: Iliess Macani
text:
Iliess Macani (born 6 December 1993) is an English <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays for the <a href="London%20Skolars">London Skolars</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20League%201">Betfred League 1</a>. He plays primarily as a winger or fullback at equal abilities and can also play as a centre.
He previously played for the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a>. Macani came through the London Broncos Scholarship and Academy teams and also played for the London Skolars juniors.
Background.
Macani was born in <a href="Tottenham%2C%20London">Tottenham</a>, <a href="London">London</a>, England.
Playing career.
London Broncos.
Macani made his <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> début for the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> on 9 August 2013 against <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> scoring a try. He went on to make 1 more appearance that season against <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>.
In 2014, Macani made 14 <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> appearances for the Broncos in 2014 scoring 4 tries with his standout performance being away at <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> impressing the nation at .
On 4 July 2014, Iliess Macani signed a 2-year contract extension with the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> to keep him at the club until the end of the 2016 season.
The 2015 season was Macani's best season to date with the winger playing 28 games and scoring 12 tries. The 21 year old was rewarded by the head coach, <a href="Andrew%20Henderson%20%28rugby%20league%29">Andrew Henderson</a> with the number 5 shirt for the 2016 season.
London Skolars.
Iliess Macani also featured for his junior club, the <a href="London%20Skolars">London Skolars</a> in the <a href="RFL%20League%201">Kingstone Press Championship 1</a> on dual registration from <a href="Super%20League">First:Utility Super League</a> club, <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> playing 7 times and scoring 4 tries.
Bradford Bulls.
Iliess Macani signed for the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a>. On 3 January 2017, <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> were placed into liquidation by administrators and the contracts of players and staff were terminated. However Macani re-signed with the new club.
Iliess featured in the pre-season friendlies against <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> and <a href="Keighley%20Cougars">Keighley Cougars</a>. Macani went on to featured in 25 games at his time with the Bulls and scored 10 tries during the <a href="2017%20Bradford%20Bulls%20season">2017 Season</a>.
Sheffield Eagles.
At the end of the season he signed a 1 year deal with <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a>. He was the third signing by the Eagles ahead of the 2018 season. He featured in the pre-season friendly against <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a>.
London Skolars.
On 14 Oct 2019 he confirmed that he had committed to <a href="London%20Skolars">London Skolars</a> for another year after the loan period ended
London Broncos (re-join).
On 15 Oct 2021 it was reported that he had rejoined <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">RFL Championship</a>
